page.title: 09Cricket club
page.content: Bosherston and Stackpole Cricket Club was formed in 1932 and currently fields two teams on Saturdays and one on Sundays.The youth team plays on Monday nights.The club has enjoyed a most successful season with the first team winning the third division of the Pembrokeshire League thereby winning promotion. The second team plays in the fourth division. The team play two miles outside Stackpole .The field is beautifully situated but it lacks many basic facilities. Most of the players come from the Castlemartin peninsula and many are farmers.This means that in busy farming periods,for example when it's silage time,the teams are considerably weakened.The players meet at the St. Govan's Inn,Bosherston.
